WRITING.TITLE: when to withdraw from a class if you don't know how you are doing or you are in between?
WRITING.TEXT:
so for most cases, people are sure they are failing and therefore ask whether to withdraw or take the F (the catch all answer is to most likely withdraw)
I can't find a case for where you are borderline passing: like hit or miss pass.
Should you take the course to its entirety (with the risk of potentially failing)? or just withdraw anyways?
I guess this is one of those gray areas. Give me what you think, if there is no generalized catch-all answer. Consider/factor in financial aid.

idk what ahri is, she's like a mix of in between
but queue times for mid tend to be long, thanks for the advice though haha

WRITING.TITLE: how does one practice mid lane?
WRITING.TEXT:
the reason I am asking this is because it is the most popular lane (we're talking about normals here) and well, if you get it to practice and happen to not do well, you screw up everyone else's experience.
the only good thing is if I don't want it, usually someone else will take it (ranked)
